actions.name: Gerbera's Relief
actions.detail: Expend a charge to clear an adjacent allied character’s condition that wasn’t caused by one of their own systems, talents, etc.

actions.name: Reveal The Mark of Naga
actions.detail: 1/scene, reveal the mark and compel your enemies' animosity. Until the start of your next turn, when any enemy within a Range equal to your Speed makes an attack against a character other than you, they receive +1 Difficulty to that attack.

name: Naga-Class NHP
effect: Gain the I Say When It Ends reaction.

actions.name: I Say When It Ends
actions.detail: You may immediately Boost and Skirmish.

name: The Gate of Opening
effect:
When you make an improvised attack, you may select one of the following effects. If you do, the attack does half damage.
  • Crush: The target makes a Hull save. On a failure, they are Shredded and Impaired until the end of their next turn.
  • Daze: The target makes an Agility save. On a failure, they are Immobilized until the end of their next turn, or by clearing the status as a Quick action.
  • Disorient: The target makes a Sensors save. On a failure, they cannot draw line of sight further than Sensors and make all attacks as though their target were Invisible until the end of their next turn.
  • Occupy: The target makes an Engineering save. On a failure, they cannot take any reactions until the start of their next turn.
description: Smash the barrier that guards your thoughts, and become unshackled. The Gates await you.

name: The Gate of Healing
effect:
1/round, after hitting an improvised attack, you may choose one of the following effects:
  • Reduce your current Heat by 1.
  • Gain 2 Overshield.
  • Clear 1 condition.
description: The journey to open the gates is unforgiving. To reach the end, you must treat yourself with the same kindness you would show to others, and hope others would show to themselves. The Gates will not be forgiving.

name: The Gates of Pain and Limit
description: When your body has reached its limit, extend past it. Push through the Gate of Pain. Destroy the Gate of Limit, and go beyond.

actions.name: The Gates of Pain and Limit
actions.detail:
Choose one of the following effects. It lasts until the end of the scene, or until you Unlock The Gates again.
  • The Gate of Pain: Your melee attacks gain Knockback +2. When you knock a character into a wall, mech, or other obstruction that would cause it to stop moving, you may force your target to pass a Hull save or take 1d6 Kinetic Damage and become Impaired until the end of its next turn.
  • The Gate of Limit: Your melee attacks gain Smart and AP.

name: The Gate of View
description: Now eclipsing your natural form, your strength can reach the horizon. But be mindful – or it may leave you behind.

actions.name: Unlock The Gate of View
actions.detail:
Give a target in line of sight a Gate Mark. Only one Gate Mark can exist at a time – if you select another target for a Gate Mark, the first disappears.
As long as a character with a Gate Mark is in line of sight, you may attack them with melee attacks as though they were adjacent to you. Any attack done this way deals Energy damage instead of Kinetic. On a critical hit, the attack may deal Burn instead.

name: The Gate of Wonder
description: Few make it this far. You are an odd talent, indeed. But be wary – you walk upon the edge of a knife. Falter even once and the Gates will shut.

actions.name: Unlock The Gate of Wonder
actions.detail: Until the end of your next turn, you are Exposed. You may teleport up to 6 spaces. You are then Immobilized until the end of your turn. You may then perform an improvised attack on each character within Burst 1.

actions.name: Autocannibalizing Reload
actions.detail: Take 5 AP kinetic damage. This damage cannot be reduced in any way. Then, reload a Loading weapon.

name: Carrier Platform
effect: An allied character that is smaller than you may board you as a Quick action. While boarded, the smaller character occupies your space and becomes Immobilized but moves when you move, mirroring your movement, including involuntary movement. They also benefit from soft cover, and are treated as being higher elevation to any non-flying characters, but can still be attacked and targeted separately. This effect lasts either for the rest of the scene, until this system is destroyed, or until they disembark as a Quick action, and are placed adjacent to you.

name: Ramshackle Hull
effect: When you would suffer involuntary movement as part of an attack or failed save, you may instead take 3 AP kinetic damage and ignore the involuntary movement.

name: Bulwark Frame
effect: Your mech gains the Guardian trait if it doesn’t already have it (adjacent allies can use your mech as hard cover). Once per round, if an ally that is using your mech as cover takes damage from an attack, you may shield them as a Reaction. If you do, both you and your ally take half of that damage instead.

actions.name: Shield
actions.trigger: An ally that is using your mech as cover takes damage from an attack.
actions.detail: Both you and your ally take half of that damage instead.
